syllabus:
1.   Course Description

    James Joyce is a master of language, and it is language that we will emphasize in this class. We will deal with Joyce's relationship with language in general in _Dubliners_, and his struggle with the English language in _A Portrait of the Artist as a Young Man_, and then the day language in _Ulysses_, and finally the night language in _Finnegans Wake_. The evolution of Joyce's language experiments, among many innovations, will be discussed along with contemporary translation theories.

1.   Required Texts

Joyce, James. _Ulysses_. 1914.

1.  Classroom Policy

1.  The Percentile Distribution: (a) Oral Reports 10%; (b) Class Participation 30%; (c) Draft: 10%; (d) Oral Presentation 20%; (e) Final Paper 30%
2.  The End-of-the-Semester Presentation
    1.  one 20-minute presentation
    2.  You are free to choose the form you think appropriate for the presentation.
3.  Class Meeting
    1.  If we do not have a guest speaker, all the students are required to share their responses to the required reading of the week before the instructor officially starts the lecture.
    2.  If we have a guest speaker for the class, all the students are required to ask questions after/during the talk.

For each day late, 5 points will be deducted from the total points of the submitted work.
